p: To further confirm the selective agonist effects of M. fistulosa essential oils on TRPA1 channels, parental HEK 293 cells were subjected to real-time calcium flux analysis in the presence of MEO Fl and MEO Lv, and representative traces illustrating the effects of TRP channel agonists and M. fistulosa essential oils on [Ca 2+] i in parental HEK 293 cells are shown in Figure 4. TRP channel agonists AITC (100 µM, TRPA1), capsaicin (100 nM, TRPV1), and GSK-1016790A (10 µM, TRPV4) showed no significant changes in baseline [Ca 2+] i in parental HEK 293 cells. Similarly, no changes in [Ca 2+] i were observed when parental HEK 293 cells were treated with either MEO Fl or MEO Lv ( Figure 4A). Receptor-effector coupling and cell viability were confirmed using ATP (25 µM) to induce transient increases in [Ca 2+] i via purinergic receptor activation. Overall, the summarized data clearly demonstrate the significant differences in MEO Fl- and MEO Lv-induced changes in [Ca 2+] i in rTRPA1-transfected and parental HEK 293 cells ( Figure 4B).
